body.name: Thermalright Frozen Notte 360 Black ARGB Water Cooling CPU Cooler, 360 Black CPU Cooler Specifications, 3×120mm PWM Fans, S-FDB V2 Bearings, Suitable for AMD/AM4/AM5, Intel 1700/1150/1151/1200/2011
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 14 hrs 7 mins
features: [Better cooling]] Water block with full copper mirror plane base + 360 specification black aluminum fin cold plate + high polymer woven protective water pipe + standard 120mm ARGB fan to create low resistance, high cooling, low Evaporative, long-life integrated water-cooled cooler.

[ARGB God Light Synchronization] The ARGB of the fan and the water-cooling head is synchronized with the 5V 3pin on the motherboard, 1600W color soft light effect, efficient cooling while providing rich lighting effects (creating a dazzling light world), supporting lighting effects Connect in series to avoid insufficient light slots.

[High-performance cold head] Using high-quality copper bottom with 0.1mm spacing, plus aluminum alloy cover and high-strength acrylic top cover, using mirror plating and reflection process to create an exclusive pump head, the life of the water-cooling head is up to 40,000 hours, and the speed is up to 5300RPM±10 %, which ensures long-term, excellent cooling of the CPU.

【3 PWM fans】TL-E12B-S balanced fan×3, the speed can reach 2000RPM±10%, the size is 120*120*25mm, the noise is≤27.7DBA, the interface: 4pin PWM, the wind pressure: 2.87mmH2O(MAX), Air volume: 72.37CFM (MAX), S-FDB V2 bearing can solve the problem of fan chattering in hoisting mode, with PWM and ARGB functions, can automatically adjust the speed according to the CPU temperature, can provide strong airflow and lower noise, ARGB Light color can be adjusted manually.

【Compatibility Extensive】Support Intel: LGA 1150/1151/1155/1156/1200/1700/2011/2066; AMD: AM4/AM5/AM2/AM2+/AM3/AM3+/FM1/FM2/FM2+, with dual platform full Metal black buckle, easy to install, can be well installed on the corresponding CPU platform, the chassis width is recommended to be greater than 250mm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great AIO for the price!!
reviews.reviewText: So, for those who have trouble keeping the temps down on the 13700k intel CPU, this has done wonders for me. The install was pretty straightforward and they also have a video on YT if you get confused. I did top mount mine just to ensure longevity of the AIO. Originally, I tried to cool the 13700k with the Peerless Assassin SE 120 air cooler. While it did an OK job, it just wasn’t able to keep the CPU from thermal throttling. Since I have installed this AIO I have been able to bring my average gaming temps down over 10°C and never once hit a thermal throttle. I also did a Cinebench 24 test, never once thermal throttled. This AIO is fantastic. The quality is on par with the expensive ones, just without the fancy LED pump face. It looks fantastic and is quiet as can be. It’s so much quieter than the air color I had, almost silent. My current idle temps are 25-26°C. This thing does the job for the 13700 CPU. I’m very happy with the purchase!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My newest build
reviews.reviewText: I used this for my personal build, first time to water cool and I absolutely love it. It keeps cpu temp in check and worked perfectly out of the box and it was so easy to install. It's the only way to go. The noise level is very quiet. Some reviews said it was noisy but this thing is not loud at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good at any price, beyond fantastic at this price
reviews.reviewText: Thermalright has consistently demonstrated one of two things: Either they have such a competitive advantage that they can produce outstanding products at half the price of their competition, OR their competition has been gouging their customers for years now. Thermalright air coolers already have a great reputation as a good "bang for the buck" option. Now their liquid coolers will too.This Frozen Notte (Italian maybe? It's a stupid name) is priced at about half, or maybe less, of its nearest competitor as far as I can tell. Cosmetically, it looks fantastic. The infinity mirror works great, and makes an amazing visual for your PC. The fans are decent looking, and the RGB lighting is nice, if perhaps a bit bright at times.Maybe you don't care about visuals and just want performance? I think it delivers here too. I'm running mine as an exhaust fan, so the radiator is already getting all the case heat along with CPU heat. With my 7900x processor, the max I run is about 80degrees C while on Flight simulator, which is perfectly acceptable to me. I wish it was a bit better, but then I feel the heat coming out of the case and wow, it puts off a lot. The radiator is obviously working to dump so much heat out the top of the case.Noise is a bit high at times, although I don't have much to compare it to. Other high-end air cooled PCs I use (typically with a HUGE Noctura air cooler) get louder when under load. I don't know how this compares to other water coolers, but it's never intrusive. The pump on this is silent, I can't even tell it's running over the other case fans in the system. Oh, and the pump is inline with the water tubes, which means you really can't mount this wrong. The pump will NEVER be the high point of they system they way they designed it. You just can't do it wrong.This thing is a real bargain. There are probably better coolers out there that will drop CPU temps by a couple of degrees. And they cost 2x or 3x what this one costs. They certainly don't look any better visually (although an LCD screen on the water block would be cool). At this price, getting anything else is just throwing money away. Buy it now, before they figure out they could charge more for it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quick set up
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Quick to setup out of the box, no issues. Its very quiet, and seems to keep my i9 12900 at a consistent 31 degrees which is pretty good for a normally hot running i9 processor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: You NEED to have the MB brackets it came with. I had no clue until I started building.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific budget option
reviews.reviewText: Recently upgraded my system (Ryzen 7 5800x w/ 64gb of RAM) to a 3090 TI, and noticed my CPU temps were hitting 80c+ suddenly. I replaced the stock Wraith Prism cooler with this, and my temps haven't gone above 70c even during hours-long 4k/120hz gaming.I've used a Corsair 360mm AIO in the past, and didn't have anywhere near this kind of impression. This thing is quiet, extremely simple to hook up, and there's no third-party software to download that interferes with everything else like iCue does. It includes a daisy-chain connector for the 3 included fans for both true PWM (which you can adjust) as well as another daisy-chain connector for ARGB setup.Only "complaint" is that mine came with the fans pre-installed in the "opposite" direction of what I needed (fan cords exposed with radiator installed). Considering that's a personal preference, I'd say that's a win for being the only complaint!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars New budget king!
reviews.reviewText: This cooler is great for the price! I'm using this on an i7-13700K with a hefty overclock, 5.8ghz for light loads and 5.6 ghz for heavy loads. In guardians of the Galaxy, the processor was pulling around 80 watts and was around 50-55C. In heavy all-core loads such as shader compilation in Hogwarts legacy or Modern Warfare, the processor was pulling around 250-280 watts and this cooler was keeping it from hitting thermal limits, staying around 88-95C.(100C is the safety limit). Without the overclock things would have been even cooler. For $70 I'd definitely recommend this for cooling an i7 or a Ryzen 9 without spending too much. The fans do get loud at full speed but they're pretty quiet in games. You could definitely adjust the fan curve to keep them at a reasonable volume.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Could be better.
reviews.reviewText: The mount for the amd am4 is not very good... an for being a 360aio it seems like it should do a lot better at cooling a Ryzen 9 5900x .
13700k 210watt 80*degrees at aida64 stress test.push n pull, arctic mx-4 +thermalright 1700 cpu bracket
